basic_authentication.description: Base 64 encoded string containing the `client_id` and `client_secret` values. The header value should be `Basic <base64(client_id:client_secret)>`.

scopes.base: Read settings of the authorized user and currencies in an account
scopes.deals:read: Read most of the data about deals and related entities - deal fields, products, followers, participants; all notes, files, filters, pipelines, stages, and statistics. Does not include access to activities (except the last and next activity related to a deal)
scopes.deals:full: Create, read, update and delete deals, its participants and followers; all files, notes, and filters. It also includes read access to deal fields, pipelines, stages, and statistics. Does not include access to activities (except the last and next activity related to a deal)
scopes.mail:full: Read, update and delete mail threads. Also grants read access to mail messages
scopes.activities:read: Read activities, its fields and types; all files and filters
scopes.activities:full: Create, read, update and delete activities and all files and filters. Also includes read access to activity fields and types
scopes.contacts:read: Read the data about persons and organizations, their related fields and followers; also all notes, files, filters
scopes.contacts:full: Create, read, update and delete persons and organizations and their followers; all notes, files, filters. Also grants read access to contacts-related fields
scopes.products:read: Read products, its fields, files, followers and products connected to a deal
scopes.products:full: Create, read, update and delete products and its fields; add products to deals
scopes.projects:read: Read projects and its fields, tasks and project templates
scopes.projects:full: Create, read, update and delete projects and its fields; add projects templates and project related tasks
scopes.users:read: Read data about users (people with access to a Pipedrive account), their permissions, roles and followers
scopes.recents:read: Read all recent changes occurred in an account. Includes data about activities, activity types, deals, files, filters, notes, persons, organizations, pipelines, stages, products and users
scopes.search:read: Search across the account for deals, persons, organizations, files and products, and see details about the returned results
scopes.admin: Allows to do many things that an administrator can do in a Pipedrive company account - create, read, update and delete pipelines and its stages; deal, person and organization fields; activity types; users and permissions, etc. It also allows the app to create webhooks and fetch and delete webhooks that are created by the app
scopes.leads:read: Read data about leads and lead labels
scopes.leads:full: Create, read, update and delete leads and lead labels
scopes.phone-integration: Enables advanced call integration features like logging call duration and other metadata, and play call recordings inside Pipedrive
scopes.goals:full: Create, read, update and delete goals
scopes.video-calls: Allows application to register as a video call integration provider and create conference links
scopes.messengers-integration: Allows application to register as a messengers integration provider and allows them to deliver incoming messages and their statuses

metaDescription:
Founded in 2010, Pipedrive is an easy and effective sales CRM that drives small business growth.

Today, Pipedrive is used by revenue teams at more than 100,000 companies worldwide. Pipedrive is headquartered in New York and has offices across Europe and the US.

The company is backed by majority holder Vista Equity Partners, Bessemer Venture Partners, Insight Partners, Atomico, and DTCP.

Learn more at www.pipedrive.com.
apiDescription:
Founded in 2010, Pipedrive is an easy and effective sales CRM that drives small business growth.

Today, Pipedrive is used by revenue teams at more than 100,000 companies worldwide. Pipedrive is headquartered in New York and has offices across Europe and the US.

The company is backed by majority holder Vista Equity Partners, Bessemer Venture Partners, Insight Partners, Atomico, and DTCP.

Learn more at www.pipedrive.com.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client ID provided to you by the Pipedrive Marketplace when you register your app

parameters.name: redirectUri
parameters.description: The callback URL you provided when you registered your app. Authorization code will be sent to that URL (if it matches with the value you entered in the registration form) if a user approves the app install. Or, if a customer declines, the corresponding error will also be sent to this URL.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: You may pass any random string as the state parameter and the same string will be returned to your app after a user authorizes access. It may be used to store the user's session ID from your app or distinguish different responses. Using state may increase security; see RFC-6749. The state parameter is not automatically available in Marketplace Manager. To enable it for your app, please write to us at marketplace.devs@pipedrive.com.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The comma-separated IDs of activities that will be deleted

methods.description: Get all activities assigned to a particular user

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user whose activities will be fetched. If omitted, the user associated with the API token will be used. If 0, activities for all company users will be fetched based on the permission sets.

parameters.name: filterId
parameters.description: The ID of the filter to use (will narrow down results if used together with `user_id` parameter)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the activity, can be one type or multiple types separated by a comma. This is in correlation with the `key_string` parameter of ActivityTypes.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For pagination, the limit of entries to be returned. If not provided, 100 items will be returned.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: For pagination, the position that represents the first result for the page

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Use the activity due date where you wish to begin fetching activities from. Insert due date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Use the activity due date where you wish to stop fetching activities from. Insert due date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: done
parameters.description: Whether the activity is done or not. 0 = Not done, 1 = Done. If omitted returns both done and not done activities.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: For pagination, the marker (an opaque string value) representing the first item on the next page

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For pagination, the limit of entries to be returned. If not provided, 100 items will be returned. Please note that a maximum value of 500 is allowed.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The time boundary that points to the start of the range of data. Datetime in ISO 8601 format. E.g. 2022-11-01 08:55:59. Operates on the `update_time` field.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The time boundary that points to the end of the range of data. Datetime in ISO 8601 format. E.g. 2022-11-01 08:55:59. Operates on the `update_time` field.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user whose activities will be fetched. If omitted, all activities are returned.

parameters.name: done
parameters.description: Whether the activity is done or not. `false` = Not done, `true` = Done. If omitted, returns both done and not done activities.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the activity, can be one type or multiple types separated by a comma. This is in correlation with the `key_string` parameter of ActivityTypes.

parameters.description: The ID of the activity

parameters.description: If supplied, only deals within the given stage will be returned

parameters.description: Only fetch deals with a specific status. If omitted, all not deleted deals are returned. If set to deleted, deals that have been deleted up to 30 days ago will be included.

parameters.description: Pagination start

parameters.description: Items shown per page

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field names and sorting mode separated by a comma (`field_name_1 ASC`, `field_name_2 DESC`). Only first-level field keys are supported (no nested keys).

parameters.name: ownedByYou
parameters.description: When supplied, only deals owned by you are returned. However, `filter_id` takes precedence over `owned_by_you` when both are supplied.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: For pagination, the marker (an opaque string value) representing the first item on the next page

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For pagination, the limit of entries to be returned. If not provided, 100 items will be returned. Please note that a maximum value of 500 is allowed.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The time boundary that points to the start of the range of data. Datetime in ISO 8601 format. E.g. 2022-11-01 08:55:59. Operates on the `update_time` field.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The time boundary that points to the end of the range of data. Datetime in ISO 8601 format. E.g. 2022-11-01 08:55:59. Operates on the `update_time` field.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: If supplied, only deals matching the given user will be returned

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: If supplied, only deals within the given stage will be returned

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Only fetch deals with a specific status. If omitted, all not deleted deals are returned. If set to deleted, deals that have been deleted up to 30 days ago will be included.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: The search term to look for. Minimum 2 characters (or 1 if using `exact_match`). Please note that the search term has to be URL encoded.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated string array. The fields to perform the search from. Defaults to all of them. Only the following custom field types are searchable: `address`, `varchar`, `text`, `varchar_auto`, `double`, `monetary` and `phone`. Read more about searching by custom fields here.

parameters.name: exactMatch
parameters.description: When enabled, only full exact matches against the given term are returned. It is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: personId
parameters.description: Will filter deals by the provided person ID. The upper limit of found deals associated with the person is 2000.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Will filter deals by the provided organization ID. The upper limit of found deals associated with the organization is 2000.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Will filter deals by the provided specific status. open = Open, won = Won, lost = Lost. The upper limit of found deals associated with the status is 2000.

parameters.name: includeFields
parameters.description: Supports including optional fields in the results which are not provided by default

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Pagination start. Note that the pagination is based on main results and does not include related items when using `search_for_related_items` parameter.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Items shown per page

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Only fetch deals with a specific status. open = Open, won = Won, lost = Lost.

parameters.name: filterId
parameters.description: user_id will not be considered. Only deals matching the given filter will be returned.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Only deals matching the given user will be returned. `user_id` will not be considered if you use `filter_id`.

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: Only deals within the given stage will be returned

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The date when the first interval starts. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
The type of the interval
ValueDescription
`day`Day
`week`A full week (7 days) starting from `start_date`
`month`A full month (depending on the number of days in given month) starting from `start_date`
`quarter`A full quarter (3 months) starting from `start_date`

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The number of given intervals, starting from `start_date`, to fetch. E.g. 3 (https://developers.pipedrive.com/docs/api/v1.

parameters.name: fieldKey
parameters.description: The date field key which deals will be retrieved from

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: If supplied, only deals matching the given user will be returned

parameters.name: pipelineId
parameters.description: If supplied, only deals matching the given pipeline will be returned

parameters.name: filterId
parameters.description: If supplied, only deals matching the given filter will be returned

parameters.name: excludeDeals
parameters.description: Whether to exclude deals list (https://developers.pipedrive.com/docs/api/v1 or not (https://developers.pipedrive.com/docs/api/v1. Note that when deals are excluded, the timeline summary (counts and values) is still returned.

parameters.name: totalsConvertCurrency
parameters.description: The 3-letter currency code of any of the supported currencies. When supplied, `totals_converted` is returned per each interval which contains the currency-converted total amounts in the given currency. You may also set this parameter to `default_currency` in which case the user's default currency is used.

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: The type of the goal. If provided, everyone's goals will be returned.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the goal

parameters.name: isActive
parameters.description: Whether the goal is active or not

parameters.name: assigneeId
parameters.description: The ID of the user who's goal to fetch. When omitted, only your goals will be returned.

parameters.name: assigneeType
parameters.description: The type of the goal's assignee. If provided, everyone's goals will be returned.

parameters.name: expectedOutcomeTarget
parameters.description: The numeric value of the outcome. If provided, everyone's goals will be returned.

parameters.name: expectedOutcomeTrackingMetric
parameters.description: The tracking metric of the expected outcome of the goal. If provided, everyone's goals will be returned.

parameters.name: expectedOutcomeCurrencyId
parameters.description: The numeric ID of the goal's currency. Only applicable to goals with `expected_outcome.tracking_metric` with value `sum`. If provided, everyone's goals will be returned.

parameters.name: typeParamsPipelineId
parameters.description: An array of pipeline IDs or `null` for all pipelines. If provided, everyone's goals will be returned.

parameters.name: typeParamsStageId
parameters.description: The ID of the stage. Applicable to only `deals_progressed` type of goals. If provided, everyone's goals will be returned.

parameters.name: typeParamsActivityTypeId
parameters.description: An array of IDs or `null` for all activity types. Only applicable for `activities_completed` and/or `activities_added` types of goals. If provided, everyone's goals will be returned.

parameters.name: periodStart
parameters.description: The start date of the period for which to find goals. Date in format of YYYY-MM-DD. When `period.start` is provided, `period.end` must be provided too.

parameters.name: periodEnd
parameters.description: The end date of the period for which to find goals. Date in format of YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the goal

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the goal

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the goal that the results are looked for

parameters.name: periodStart
parameters.description: The start date of the period for which to find the goal's progress. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. This date must be the same or after the goal duration start date.

parameters.name: periodEnd
parameters.description: The end date of the period for which to find the goal's progress. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. This date must be the same or before the goal duration end date.

methods.description: Perform a search from multiple item types

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: The search term to look for. Minimum 2 characters (or 1 if using `exact_match`). Please note that the search term has to be URL encoded.

parameters.name: itemTypes
parameters.description: A comma-separated string array. The type of items to perform the search from. Defaults to all.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated string array. The fields to perform the search from. Defaults to all. Relevant for each item type are:
Item typeField
Deal`custom_fields`, `notes`, `title`
Person`custom_fields`, `email`, `name`, `notes`, `phone`
Organization`address`, `custom_fields`, `name`, `notes`
Product`code`, `custom_fields`, `name`
Lead`custom_fields`, `notes`, `email`, `organization_name`, `person_name`, `phone`, `title`
File`name`
Mail attachment`name`
Project `custom_fields`, `notes`, `title`, `description`

Only the following custom field types are searchable: `address`, `varchar`, `text`, `varchar_auto`, `double`, `monetary` and `phone`. Read more about searching by custom fields here.
When searching for leads, the email, organization_name, person_name, and phone fields will return results only for leads not linked to contacts. For searching leads by person or organization values, please use `search_for_related_items`.

parameters.name: searchForRelatedItems
parameters.description: When enabled, the response will include up to 100 newest related leads and 100 newest related deals for each found person and organization and up to 100 newest related persons for each found organization

parameters.name: exactMatch
parameters.description: When enabled, only full exact matches against the given term are returned. It is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: includeFields
parameters.description: A comma-separated string array. Supports including optional fields in the results which are not provided by default.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Pagination start. Note that the pagination is based on main results and does not include related items when using `search_for_related_items` parameter.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Items shown per page

methods.description: Perform a search using a specific field from an item type

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: The search term to look for. Minimum 2 characters (or 1 if using `exact_match`). Please note that the search term has to be URL encoded.

parameters.name: fieldType
parameters.description: The type of the field to perform the search from

parameters.name: exactMatch
parameters.description: When enabled, only full exact matches against the given term are returned. The search is case sensitive.

parameters.name: fieldKey
parameters.description: The key of the field to search from. The field key can be obtained by fetching the list of the fields using any of the fields' API GET methods (dealFields, personFields, etc.). Only the following custom field types are searchable: `address`, `varchar`, `text`, `varchar_auto`, `double`, `monetary` and `phone`. Read more about searching by custom fields here.

parameters.name: returnItemIds
parameters.description: Whether to return the IDs of the matching items or not. When not set or set to `0` or `false`, only distinct values of the searched field are returned. When set to `1` or `true`, the ID of each found item is returned.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Pagination start

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Items shown per page

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For pagination, the limit of entries to be returned. If not provided, 100 items will be returned.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: For pagination, the position that represents the first result for the page

parameters.name: archivedStatus
parameters.description: Filtering based on the archived status of a lead. If not provided, `All` is used.

parameters.name: ownerId
parameters.description: If supplied, only leads matching the given user will be returned. However, `filter_id` takes precedence over `owner_id` when supplied.

parameters.name: personId
parameters.description: If supplied, only leads matching the given person will be returned. However, `filter_id` takes precedence over `person_id` when supplied.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: If supplied, only leads matching the given organization will be returned. However, `filter_id` takes precedence over `organization_id` when supplied.

parameters.name: filterId
parameters.description: The ID of the filter to use

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field names and sorting mode separated by a comma (`field_name_1 ASC`, `field_name_2 DESC`). Only first-level field keys are supported (no nested keys).

Indirect relations include relations through custom, organization-type fields and through persons of the given organization.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: For pagination, the marker (an opaque string value) representing the first item on the next page

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For pagination, the limit of entries to be returned. If not provided, up to 500 items will be returned.

parameters.name: assigneeId
parameters.description: If supplied, only tasks that are assigned to this user are returned

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: If supplied, only tasks that are assigned to this project are returned

parameters.name: parentTaskId
parameters.description: If `null` is supplied then only parent tasks are returned. If integer is supplied then only subtasks of a specific task are returned. By default all tasks are returned.

parameters.name: done
parameters.description: Whether the task is done or not. `0` = Not done, `1` = Done. If not omitted then returns both done and not done tasks.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the task

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: The search term to look for

parameters.name: searchByEmail
parameters.description: When enabled, the term will only be matched against email addresses of users. Default: `false`.

repositoryDescription: Founded in 2010, Pipedrive is a leading sales CRM for small businesses, used by over 100,000 companies globally with offices in NY and Europe. Backed by Vista Equity Partners, Bessemer, Insight, Atomico, and DTCP. Pipedrive's {language} SDK generated by Konfig (https://konfigthis.com/).
